comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content:
There are three pictures which all depict the Martin : 67 (also Catalog #: 00068705 and 00068704) but are obviously different machines.

This is probably not the Martin of Glenn Martin fame.

Anything more known about this Martin and his (at least) three different machines?

comment.author: 49487266@N07
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/varese2002] I looks as if this airplane was not identified correctly. It is the Martin Model 66, as seen here: aviadesign.online.fr/MARTIN/INDEX.html
comment.authorname: San Diego Air & Space Museum Archives

comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: You are right a (very) little known machine also described by Aerofiles here aerofiles.com/_martin.html The biplane is from 1923 and described as a Night Mail Plane powered by a 200hp Wright-Hisso E-4; span: 42'0" length: 28'0" . Aerofiles gives that three examples were built. Special I-style struts are visible in the construction. To complicate the historical matter the Glenn L. Martin Aviation Museum has some more information about the Martin 66 (also given as the MNM-1) here www.marylandaviationmuseum.org/pdf/Ex1_spec.pdf
